SEARCH
Package com.serezk4.io

Interface IOWorker<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of data handled by the worker
All Superinterfaces:
AutoCloseable
All Known Subinterfaces:
ConsoleWorker, FileWorker, Formatter<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
BufferedConsoleWorker, BufferedFileWorker, DequeWorker, JsonFormatter
public interface IOWorker<T> extends AutoCloseable
Interface for reading and writing data.

The IOWorker interface provides methods for handling input and output operations, including reading, writing, and checking readiness. It also supports optional prompts and data insertion for extended functionality.

Since:
1.0
See Also:

    close

  • Method Details

    • read

      T read()
      Reads data.

      This method retrieves the next available piece of data. The exact behavior depends on the implementation.

      Returns:
      the data read, or null if no data is available

    • read

      default T read(T prompt)
      Reads data with a prompt.

      Displays the given prompt before reading data, allowing for interactive input.

      Parameters:
      prompt - the prompt to display before reading
      Returns:
      the data read

    • write

      void write(T data)
      Writes data.

      Outputs the specified data using the worker's implementation.

      Parameters:
      data - the data to write

    • insert

      default void insert(T data)
      Inserts data into the worker.

      This method provides additional data to the worker for future operations. The behavior depends on the implementation and may include buffering or queueing the data.

      Parameters:
      data - the data to insert

    • ready

      boolean ready()
      Checks if the worker is ready for I/O operations.

      Returns true if the worker can perform read or write operations without blocking or errors.

      Returns:
      true if the worker is ready, false otherwise
